description: Defines the basic information components for all configurable elements in a device topology

contents.name: ParameterSet
contents.description: Flat list of Parameters

contents.name: MethodSet
contents.description: Flat list of Methods

contents.name: GroupIdentifier
contents.description: An application specific functional group used to organize parameters and methods.

contents.name: Identification
contents.description: Used to organize parameters for identification of this TopologyElement

contents.name: Lock
contents.description: Used to lock the topology element.

description: Defines the basic information components for all configurable elements in a device topology

contents.name: DeviceTypeImage
contents.description: Organizes pictures of the device.

contents.name: Documentation
contents.description: Organizes documents for the device.

contents.name: ProtocolSupport
contents.description: Protocol-specific files for the device.

contents.name: ImageSet
contents.description: Organizes images that are used within UIElements.

description: Adds the concept of Blocks needed for block-oriented FieldDevices

contents.name: RevisionCounter
contents.description: Incremental counter indicating the number of times the static data within the Block has been modified

contents.name: ActualMode
contents.description: Current mode of operation the Block is able to achieve

contents.name: PermittedMode
contents.description: Modes of operation that are allowed for the Block based on application requirements

contents.name: NormalMode
contents.description: Mode the Block should be set to during normal operating conditions

contents.name: TargetMode
contents.description: Mode of operation that is desired for the Block

description: Defines a general pattern to expose and configure modular components

contents.name: SupportedTypes
contents.description: Folder maintaining the set of (sub-types of) BaseObjectTypes that can be instantiated in the ConfigurableComponent

description: Base indication type not further defining a semantic
Indicates the time the entity has been in use or can still be used
Indicates the total number of parts that have been produced or can still be produced.
Indicates counting the process steps the entity has been used or can still be used for (for example usages of a punching tool).
Indicates the abraded length, for example of a drill.
Indicates the abraded diameter, for example of a drill.
Indicates the volume of a substance, for example of a liquid.
FolderType is used to organize the Parameters and Methods from the complete set (ParameterSet, MethodSet) with regard to their application

contents.name: UIElement
contents.description: A user interface element assigned to this group.

contents.name: GroupIdentifier
contents.description: An application specific functional group used to organize parameters and methods.

description: General structure of a Protocol ObjectType
Interface defining counters for the duration of operation

contents.name: PowerOnDuration
contents.description: PowerOnDuration is the duration the Device has been powered. The main purpose is to determine the time in which degradation of the Device occurred. The details, when the time is counted, is implementation-specific. Companion specifications might define specific rules. Typically, when the Device has supply voltage and the main CPU is running, the time is counted. This may include any kind of sleep mode, but may not include pure Wake on LAN. This value shall only increase during the lifetime of the Device and shall not be reset when the Device is restarted. The PowerOnDuration is provided as Duration, i.e., in milliseconds or even fractions of a millisecond. However, the Server is not expected to update the value in such a high frequency, but maybe once a minute or once an hour, depending on the application.

contents.name: OperationDuration
contents.description: OperationDuration is the duration the Device has been powered and performing an activity. This counter is intended for Devices where a distinction is made between switched on and in operation. For example, a drive might be powered on but not operating. It is not intended for Devices always performing an activity like sensors always measuring data. This value shall only increase during the lifetime of the Device and shall not be reset when the Device is restarted. The OperationDuration is provided as Duration, i.e., in milliseconds or even fractions of a millisecond. However, the Server is not expected to update the value in such a high frequency, but maybe once a minute or once an hour, depending on the application.

contents.name: OperationCycleCounter
contents.description: OperationCycleCounter is counting the times the Device switches from not performing an activity to performing an activity. For example, each time a valve starts moving, is counted. This value shall only increase during the lifetime of the Device and shall not be reset when the Device is restarted.

description: Represents the communication means for Devices that are connected to it.

contents.name: Lock
contents.description: Used to lock the Network.

description: Represents the interface (interface card) of a Device to a Network.

contents.name: NetworkAddress
contents.description: The address of the device on this network.

schemas.description: If KeepsParameters is not set, the device will lose its configuration during update. The Client should do a backup of the parameters before the update and restore them afterwards.
